iterations.description: Current behavior destroys a session tab immediately on disconnect, which removes context and makes quick switching/reconnect workflows harder as described by commenters.

comments.author: GitCitizen
comments.snippet:
Any response to the 2nd part of this? This is a show stopper for me. I deal with sensitive data and can't have the screen automatically switch to another logged in server after logging off.  
Thanks

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: @GitCitizen Can you explain more? I don't see how @jfrcs3's 2nd request would help with that situation. He is just requesting that the currently selected connection is highlighted in the connection tree window.

comments.author: GitCitizen
comments.snippet:
First this is a GREAT program. I just found it but did spend some google time looking for a solution but was unsuccessful.

 

I will have several servers open and after logging off one of them, mRemote will automatically switch to the previously (and currently) logged in server screen but stays on the server name under connections. This is very confusing and not the action I want. I want to make my own choice which server to select next, if any. 

 

Thanks for your help

comments.snippet:
Ah gotcha. Currently the existence of a connection tab/panel is very closely tied to the state of the connection. Once a connection disconnects, the tab/panel it was being shown within is immediately destroyed. We could maybe just display a "Connection is closed" message in that panel instead of immediately closing it. This could be a setting - auto-close like we do now or display a message. 

@GitCitizen Would you mind creating a new issue for this? While it's slightly related to this issue, ...

notes:
AI triage (codex): Current behavior destroys a session tab immediately on disconnect, which removes context and makes quick switching/reconnect workflows harder as described by commenters.
Approach: Decouple tab lifetime from live connection state by keeping the tab after disconnect, showing a lightweight 'connection closed' state in that tab, and preserving selected-connection tracking so users can switch or reconnect from the same context.
